content.description: Starts on same rail as Black Slab RIght, but trends left from the jug to a moderate sloper and some challenging gastons/credit cards edges.

Uber Classic.  This problem was recently up-rated on a popular consensus from it's original rating of V6.  No matter what it is, this problem is sweet.  Start SDS on a sloping rail with a toe hook and press with your feet.  Make a big move up to the slope on the lip and match (crux).  Top out up and right.  The stand start from the sloper at the lip goes at V4.
content.location: Walk around the corner (away from the cave) from Kung Fu Grip.  Same start as Mortal Kombat.

content.description: First boulder problem on the shady warm up wall.  This boulder is sometimes referred to as the ladder boulder, since the horizontal holds trace a ladder to the top.  This is the leftmost boulder problem.  Make a hard move off the ground, or start on the standing hold (V0), move up towards the scoop and make an interesting mantle.
content.location: Shady side of the boulder, far left problem on warm up wall.

content.description: SDS just right of the arete on the shady side of the cave boulder (ladder) make a couple tough pulls to a balancey arete finish.
content.location: 20 feet right of black slab on the r side of the corner.

content.description: Sit start on block for Rotator Cuff Sit. Make first move up right. Then dyno from good edge to good edge up left. Top out/mantle same as Green Knob. Possibly the easiest way up the face depending on your style and height.
content.location: Same start as Rotator Cuff. Downhill side of Ladder boulder near cave.

content.description: Classic!  Same start on the large detached block as The Green Knob.  Move up and right along crimps, under clings, and a bizarre crescent shaped feature.  Focus hard on your left foot and move up to a crimp/jug facing the opposite direction.  Top out.  This problem is often hot and muggy, but is not to be missed.  Work it a little bit and you will find out where its namesake came from!  Starting on the second rail (skipping 1st two moves) goes at V5.  Very sequential and technical.
content.location: Other side of the cave, right of The Green Knob.

content.description: I cannot send this problem, but it looks fantastic!  Start on the SDS holds for Xiaolin Wonder Palm and traverse into Kung Fu Grip, top out same as Kung Fu Grip or the Happy Ending finish for added challenge!
content.protection: Good Landing, multiple pads or spotters
content.location: Move right around the corner from Kung Fu Grip

content.description: Left problem on the shady side of the warm up wall.  SDS on low holds generally trending up and right.  Finish straight up with a crimpy crux just before the lip.
content.location: Right side of the shady side of the warm up boulder.

content.description: Classic!  Start on a large sloping pinch to the right of the warm up problems on the shady side of the boulder.  This problem stays pretty crisp even on hotter days at Rumbling Bald.  Move up and match the square block, them move off the block to the crimp (crux).  Make a big move left and top out on the ramp.  This problem is very heel hook intensive.
content.location: Obvious chalked up sloping pinch which marks the start of the problem, shady side of boulder.

content.description: Alternate Finish for Kung Fu Grip or Mortal Kombat (V10?).  Instead of toping out to the left on the ramp, move up straight onto the spicier slab.  There are some small hidden crimps.

climbs.name: The Green Knob (SDS V7 Stand V5)

content.description: Classic!  All the way around the corner and into the Sun from Xiaolin Wonder Palm, or simply walk through the cave from the warm up problems and look to your left.  Start on a large detached block and move your right hand up to a good side pull.  Re-situate your feet and make a hard move up to a small crimp around to the left (crux SDS).  Starting from the crimp and side pull goes at V5.  Make a powerful move up to the intermediate crimp or go all the way to the jug, make a bizarre mantle move (being short or very flexible hips is helpful) and top out.
content.location: Other side of the cave, obvious chalked up detached block (same start as Rotator Cuff).

content.description: Low-start on incut flakes. Overcome the small bulge and climb right-facing ramp / flakes up the face.
content.location: East face of the Ladder Boulder, just left of Step Ladder.

content.description:
Start matched on good holds at the base of the cave. Keep your feet high and traverse the entire length of the roof (watch out for choss falling on your head). Once at the north end of the cave link up into

Cave Rave

and climb under the tree and finish up.
content.protection: Several pads inside cave or a buddy to move a pad for you
content.location: South face of Cave and Ladder boulder just inside the cave

content.description: Start on the jug in the cave and traverse out and under the tree with some long reaches along the way.  Finish up on the crimpy finish to Unknown V1 just to the left.
content.location: Start in the obvious cave on the huge, heavily chalked jug.

content.description: start same as Black slab left sds, but climb Black slab right to the top.
Start matched on small crimp rail.  Climb up to jug and continue to the top.
Starts on sloping rail, make a long move to the rail of the stand,  trends left from the jug to a moderate sloper and some challenging gastons/credit cards edges.
Flat landings and wide variety of grades. Awesome boulder and will most likely always have a few people around.
